intro: Daviesia chapmanii, commonly known as the Chapman's daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish-orange flowers, which bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Daviesia chapmanii is well adapted to the dry conditions of its native habitat.
